alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:12PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Weld County through 245 PM MDT... At 212 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles east of South Greeley to 3 miles west of Milton Reservoir, or along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Cheyenne to 12 miles south of Greeley. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greeley, Evans, Milliken, Eaton, LaSalle, Ault, Kersey, Gilcrest, Pierce, Grover, Purcell, Galeton, Gill, Barnesville, Hereford, Briggsdale and Lucerne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central and South Weld County; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County
